DOC.brief_summary: An efficacy study assess analgesic effect ibuprofen/caffeine post-surgical dental pain .
DOC.brief_title: A Dental Pain Study Comparing The Analgesic Efficacy Of Ibuprofen/Caffeine
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study assess analgesic efficacy fix dose combination ibuprofen/caffeine compare ibuprofen alone also placebo .
DOC.criteria: Males females 16 year 40 year age ( inclusive ) . Subjects undergone outpatient surgical extraction 3 third molar , least 2 must partial complete bony mandibular impaction within 30 day Screening meet baseline pain criterion describe protocol Examined attend dentist physician medically clear participate study . Evidence history clinically significant hematological , renal , endocrine , pulmonary , gastrointestinal , cardiovascular , hepatic , psychiatric , neurologic , metabolic allergic disease ( include drug allergy , exclude untreated , asymptomatic , seasonal allergy time dose ) determine Investigator place subject increase risk include presence history within 2 year screen follow medical conditions/disorders : Bleeding disorder ; Gastrointestinal ulcer gastrointestinal bleeding ; Paralytic ileus gastrointestinal obstructive disorder . Pregnant female subject ; breastfeed female subject ; fertile male subject female subject childbearing potential unwilling unable use highly effective method contraception Hypersensitivity ibuprofen , naproxen , aspirin , NSAID , caffeine , component product .
